definitions.definition: The vertical edge of a sail that is closest to the direction of the wind .
examples: By easing the halyard, the luff of the sail was made to sag to leeward.

definitions.definition: The act of sailing a ship close to the wind.
The roundest part of a ship's bow .
The forward or weather leech of a sail, especially of the jib , spanker , and other fore-and-aft sails.

main_definition: ( nautical ) The vertical edge of a sail that is closest to the direction of the wind .
secondary_definitions: ( nautical ) The act of sailing a ship close to the wind.
( nautical ) The roundest part of a ship's bow .
( nautical ) The forward or weather leech of a sail, especially of the jib , spanker , and other fore-and-aft sails.
